scene.name: intro
scene.line: Oh, sure, I know you'll want to look. "Kick the tires" — that's a thing we do, isn't it?
As though our knees could exert the kind of force these tires see out there on the road. We're more likely to hurt ourselves. Isn't it the way? Eh?
scene.option: Sure, they're big machines, but they can be fragile.

scene.name: tires-ok
scene.line: Oh, I'm sure. It wasn't the tires that failed our dear Miguel, we are quite sure.

scene.name: fragile
scene.line: Absolutely. A truck deserves care and fearful respect, like a glass elephant. Miguel was a good driver, but he didn't have that quality of deference.

scene.name: miguel-options
scene.option: What kind of man was Miguel?
`Conway sat in a dim room full of folding chairs.`

scene.name: about-miguel
scene.line: As I always say of him, he was good company. Many of us have found ourselves in his position, arrogantly grasping at personal sovereignty when our lives had become unmanageable — there's no shame in it, only condolence.
Now, what else can we show you?

scene.name: aa-vignette
scene.line: `The walls and ceiling were painted with old smoke. Someone read from the book. He drank coffee, as it iswith a little sugar.`
scene.option: `He was just waiting for it to be over.`

scene.name: listen
scene.line: `The speaker listed all the things "we" tried. That "we" ... most people in the room were probably there by court order.`

scene.name: wait
scene.line: `A few others shared. They spoke in abstractions like "a program of action," a "good orderly direction," "spiritual but not religious," "religious but not spiritual" ... all the things "we" tried.`
`Then it was over, they clasped sweaty hands through a short prayer, and stepped back out into the morning.`
scene.option: `He knew it was time to hit the bar.`

scene.name: bar
scene.line: `It was good to get out of the heat, away from the mendacity. He settled into it. Someone else from the meeting was here, looking rough.`

scene.name: talk
scene.line: `She was on a bender; a week and counting. She'd arrived at the meeting drunk and sat in the back, because she didn't believe in it.`

`She read a lot of French books, and didn't believe in anything but "the benign indifference of the universe." It was comforting, in its way. She didn't have to prefer one thought or day over any other.`
`All she had to do was drink, and stay indifferent.`

scene.name: watch
scene.line: `A nature show was playing. Something about river dolphins. They cruised the Amazon, eating psychedelic frogs and having weird adventures.`
`At night, they transformed into attractive young party-goers, and wore hats to cover their blowholes.`

scene.name: walk
scene.line: `He was always walking, these days. It was good to slow down. It felt clarifying, like a walking meditation. The road ran by a creek for a while.`
`He took an unforeseen detour where the creek and road parted, following the edge of the water. He skipped a few stones, alone, then stopped to consider an overturned boat.`
`It was a kind of serenity, that wandering and looking without purpose.`
`He was coming to rely on those moments.`

scene.name: vignette-end
scene.line: Now, what else can we show you?
